reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: This award strives to help nations achieve sustainable improvements in the well-being and productivity of their populations through effective and accountable investments in education and other social services. This includes Global Education Framework (GEF) - Create Enabling Classroom Environment: Funds used to support creating an enabling classroom environment for improved reading and learning activities.. Global Education Framework (GEF) - Promoting Gender across Sectors-Safe Schools III: Funds used to conduct gender-related trainings and technical assistance with Volunteers and work partners, and implement the training packages developed under the Safe Sc. Global Education Framework (GEF) - Regional Literacy Trainings: Funds used to support a literacy specialist to provide to help improve early grade reading and youth literacy.. Global Education Framework (GEF) - Regional Literacy Trainings: Funds used to support a literacy specialist to provide technical support, advice, and training materials to the field to help improve early grade reading and youth literacy..

To help nations achieve sustainable improvements in the well-being and productivity of their populations through effective and accountable investments in education and other social services. Promote equitable, effective, accountable, and sustainable formal and non-formal education systems.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. assistance to Jamaica focuses on reducing violent crime and instability and addressing the negative effects of climate change. U.S. assistance will improve Jamaica's resiliency to extreme climate and variable weather events and strengthen Jamaica's ability to implement adaptive strategies and pursue low carbon emission development. Climatic shifts pose significant threats to major infrastructure and to the livelihoods of urban and rural communities across Jamaica. To advance security and citizen safety, programs through the Caribbean Basin Security Initiative (CBSI) will complement and enhance bilateral assistance by strengthening Jamaica's security capacity and ability to address both domestic and transnational threats, such as illicit narcotics trafficking. CBSI~programs are requested through the State Department's Western Hemisphere Regional Congressional Budget Justification.
Costs associated with activities funded under most reimbursable agreements.
